history.text: Hello!
Hello!
The document is about Zootopia. Have you seen it?
I have not. Is it a child's movie?
It's animated but not necessarily only for children. It deals with some interesting subject matter that give it something for older viewers to enjoy as well.
Awesome! What is it about?

An optimistic rabbit named Judy Hopps has always dreamed of being a member of the police officer in the big city of Zootopia ever since she was a child. She passes her exams with flying colors but her Chief doubts her capabilities as an officer because she is a rabbit. On her first day she meets a con artist duo of Nick Wilde the fox and his friend Finnick. The movie is about her trying to prove herself as a police officer.
That sounds interesting. Are there any famous actors to voice the characters?

Ginnifer Goodwin plays Judy Hopps. Jason Bateman plays as Nick Wilde. Idris Elba is Chief Bogo, the African buffalo leader of the Zootopia Police Force. And Jenny Slate voices Dawn Bellwether, the mayor of Zootopia's diminutive sheep assistant.
Nice! Did it do well in the box office?

I'm not sure about it's earnings but it was regarded very well by critics. It has a 98% rating on Rotten Tomatoes. It was hailed as a well rounded thoughtful film that asked it's viewers to do some thinking while they enjoyed the animation.
That sounds like a very successful movie!
Sounds like a movie both my kids and I could enjoy
Do you generally like watching animated films?
I do! More than my kids I think.
It's a comedy so maybe a few laughs will help keep their attention! Haha
One of the interesting parts of the film is how predators are stereotyped in this society of animals. They're seen as untrustworthy by the other animals that we would normally consider prey.
That is interesting! You mentioned the conartist was a fox, that definitely is a stereotype!

That's one of the points some critics noticed. That while the film does constantly try to show that stereotypes aren't always right, they accidentally made several of the stereotypes match the animals.
In fact, Nick was bullied as a child for trying to join the movie's version of the Boy Scouts because they thought foxes were untrustworthy. So he proves them wrong...by becoming a con artist.
That's kind of funny. However, even if it wasn't animated, movies still tend to sterotype.
That's true. Though an interesting point is that a con artist like Nick and Judy, a police officer, wind up working together to solve a mystery.
This sounds like a movie I wouldn't mind watching. I hope they successfully solved their mystery.
They do though there are some twists and turns along the way. Do you find that you usually enjoy watching mystery movies or shows?
As a child I found myself watching Scooby Doo more often than not!
So with talking animals, a mystery, and some funny moments this movie might be right up your alley!
That's exactly what I was thinking. Do you think the movie could appeal to grandparents as well?
It could! With a Rotten Tomatoes score of 98% I'm sure there's something in it for everyone especially if they like animals, mysteries, or just a good funny movie.
I feel like movies rarely have that great of a score!

uid2response.feedback: I have not seen the movie before but I think I will give it a try!
